column1: #Text=In the early Olympic games , athletes used to run a mile and then recite a poem .
#Text=The first poet-in-residence of an English football team , Ian McMillan , remarked that football chants are like huge tribal poems .
#Text=Generally , though , sport and poetry have never seemed natural companions in human enterprise .
#Text=Until the New York Mets baseball team suffered in 2007 arguably the worst collapse in Major League Baseball history .
#Text=To describe the anguish fans felt , The New York Times turned to a poet , Frank Messina .
#Text=" Nothing was really representing the fan 's point of view , " Messina told Wikinews reporter David Shankbone in an interview .
#Text=" There 's a lot of hurting people out there who ca n't express what happened .

#Text=And to those who read the Times last Saturday , Messina wants you to know his father never apologized for raising him as a Mets fans .

#Text= Benigno sounded similar to avant-garde writer and musician David Amram , who said Messina 's poems paint " the stark beauty of the streets , the pain of 9/11 , the joy of everyday life , the mysteries of love all fill the pages of this book .

column1: #Text=It 's a feast of images and sounds that stay with you .
